extendedIngredients.name: boule
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 crusty sourdough or country-style boule, about 7 inches in diameter

extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: fresh dill
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, plus a sprig for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: goat cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces goat cheese, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: leeks
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 medium leeks, white and light green part halved lengthwise and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: mixed vegetables
extendedIngredients.originalString: Assorted raw vegetables for serving, such as carrot sticks, celery sticks, sliced bell peppers and sliced radishes
metaInformation: such as carrot sticks, celery sticks, sliced bell peppers and sliced radishes

recipes.title: Hot Leek Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are great choices for Dip. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.                          Make a bread bowl by cutting off the top third of the loaf of bread to expose the inner crumb. Use your fingers to tear out the crumb, trying to keep it in large pieces. Cut or tear the crumb of the bread into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Place the bread bowl and the bread pieces on a baking sheet and bake until slightly dried out and lightly toasted, about 10 minutes.                          Put the leeks in a large bowl of water and wash thoroughly; drain.                          Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the leeks, garlic, cayenne, salt and pepper to taste and cook, stirring occasionally, until very tender and golden in parts, about 10 minutes. Add the milk and bring to a simmer. Add the cream cheese and goat cheese a few spoonfuls at a time, stirring well after each addition, until all of the cheese is smoothly incorporated. Continue to cook, stirring, until the dip is hot, about 3 minutes more. Stir in the dill, lemon zest and juice and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to the bread bowl and garnish with the dill sprig. Serve with the toasted bread and vegetables for dipping. Top with bread top as decoration.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Make a bread bowl by cutting off the top third of the loaf of bread to expose the inner crumb. Use your fingers to tear out the crumb, trying to keep it in large pieces.
Cut or tear the crumb of the bread into 1 1/2-inch pieces.
Place the bread bowl and the bread pieces on a baking sheet and bake until slightly dried out and lightly toasted, about 10 minutes.
Put the leeks in a large bowl of water and wash thoroughly; drain.
Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the leeks, garlic, cayenne, salt and pepper to taste and cook, stirring occasionally, until very tender and golden in parts, about 10 minutes.
Add the milk and bring to a simmer.

Add the cream cheese and goat cheese a few spoonfuls at a time, stirring well after each addition, until all of the cheese is smoothly incorporated. Continue to cook, stirring, until the dip is hot, about 3 minutes more. Stir in the dill, lemon zest and juice and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to the bread bowl and garnish with the dill sprig.
Serve with the toasted bread and vegetables for dipping. Top with bread top as decoration.
